item.title: Digital Hygiene Part 2: Password Manager
item.description: In this installment we are going to look at the elephant in the room of digital security: passwords. Two most common sins against security committed by millions, or billions of Internet users are 1) weak passwords and 2) password reuse. It is now widely recognised that it is not the users who are to blame, but the password system itself. It is inconceivable that a single person can remember dozens of different, complicated passwords for different online services the modern world all but forces us to use.

item.title: Digital Hygiene Part 1: VPN
item.description: A few years ago I used to not care much about the digital trail I left all over the internet. The optimistic assumption “nothing to hide, nothing to fear”, convenience of numerous new services that offered some minor perk in exchange for my data, and the general trend for the population of developed world to share more and more, all pushed in that direction. Since then, a couple of developments changed my attitude.
